instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL5269: What is ISL5269? This is a typo of ISL6259.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.P5VS3_EN_L: What is P5VS3_EN_L? P5VS3_EN_L is a signal that enables the PP5V_S3 power rail when it is low.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light and Charges - No fan spin / power - Liquid Damaged
threads.message:
Moderate liquid damage on  board, above and under. <RESISTOR>R6920</RESISTOR>(47ohm resistor), <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR>(<SIGNAL>DCIN_S5_VSENSE</SIGNAL>) and <CHIP>ISL5269</CHIP> were fried, replaced and got a green light. I thought these boards were supposed to be amber when no battery is present. Anyhow, if I attach a discharged battery then it turns amber and charges it. SMC reset also works. Any Ideas where to start? I can usually fix most boards but this model seems a lot more complicated or different than the others. 

Also, I see that some of the caps around <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> area are corroded. Also, <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>.

Adapter sense fluctuates between 3.2v and 3.33v
DCIN 18v5 flucuates between 16.42v and 16.78v
PP3v42 at 3.39v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> very low at 1.1v

I've replaced ISL twice just in case and same result. I'm thinking the issue lies around <CHIP>U5010</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light and Charges - No fan spin / power - Liquid Damaged
threads.message: PPBUS is needed first. 1.1V would almost suggest there is a short to GND, so check that first. Light should also go orange even without a battery, but that can be dealt with after PPBUS.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light and Charges - No fan spin / power - Liquid Damaged
threads.message:
You're correct, something is pulling ppbus down to 500ohm resistance to ground. I'm going to look around the line until further instructions

EDIT: I have 12.3v on ppbus now and amber light without battery, it turned out to be a bad <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP> solder job or IC... still no fan spin or power

seems off: pm_slp_ <SIGNAL>S5_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3v, <SIGNAL>S4_L</SIGNAL> is .4v, <SIGNAL>S3_R_L</SIGNAL>,_L is 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> is 5v, S3 missing, S0 is 5v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> 1.4v, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL> is at 3v3

<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_REG</SIGNAL> at .9v

cpu and pch gets warm,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light and Charges - No fan spin / power - Liquid Damaged
threads.message:
12.3V would at least mean the ISL is not talking to the SMC, but that is a later concern but expect a dead SMC.

Is <SIGNAL>P5VS3_EN</SIGNAL> present? <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light and Charges - No fan spin / power - Liquid Damaged
threads.message: SMC did have quite a bit of corrosion on the test points surrounding it, I would not be surprised. I will check those two circuits when I get back to my workshop. Thanks Duke for your help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light and Charges - No fan spin / power - Liquid Damaged
threads.message:
I'm getting 4.9v on pin 3(<SIGNAL>P5VS3_EN_L</SIGNAL> of <TRANSISTOR>Q7852</TRANSISTOR>(SSM3K15FV), but not pin 1(No _L; 15ohm resistance to ground which seems short), which schematics show they should both be on. I tested and see the low resistance is on the <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> side. I forgot to mention <CHIP>U7940</CHIP> has been replaced before, the <SIGNAL>PM_SUS_EN</SIGNAL> ic.

<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is not present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light and Charges - No fan spin / power - Liquid Damaged
threads.message: This is NOT looking good, I'm afraid this one is pretty fried! Time waster board....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Green Light and Charges - No fan spin / power - Liquid Damaged
threads.message: Noted, thank you for your help, I will put this board aside to mess with while I have spare time.
